Loader

Introduction

Loader gives to the user feedback that system is working in background and that the user has to wait before for example content is loaded. Loader has clockwise ongoing animation with additional text.

Principles

Spinner loader is used in components where is expected that content is not loaded instantly, the loading process will take a while. Spinner is placed in a square and additional text is placed in a box.

Best practices and recommendations

  • Loader is aligned to the center of the component.
  • Additional text is placed under spinner and aligned to the center.
  • Additional text is not used with spinner in input fields.
  • In input fields is loader aligned to the right and it conveys information that system is working, e.g., something is happening (processing) in the background.
  • In buttons is loader placed on the left side of the text and the button becomes wider to preserve recommended space between elements inside the button like the text and loader animation.
  • Loader in button should be used on the end of complete flow for actions like finishing order or submitting. Additional text in the button has three states which is described in States of loading.
Loader is aligned to the center of the component.
Additional text is placed under spinner and aligned to the center.
Additional text is not used with spinner in input fields.
In buttons is loader placed on the left side of the text and the button becomes wider to preserve recommended space between elements inside the button like the text and loader animation.

The types and versions

Basically the Spinner loader consists of two parts â€“ spinner (SVG animation) and additional text. Spinner is partly transparent and ongoing. Additional text is not transparent and without animation.

There are 3 sizes of the loader, calculated for the desktop screens:

1. Small spinner (24x24px)
24 x 24px (1.5rem x 1.5rem)

Designed for:

  • buttons (with or without text),
  • input fields (without text)

Size & style: width - 24px, height - 24px;

2. Moderate spinner (48px48px)
48 x 48px (3rem x 3rem)

Please wait

Designed for:

  • small tables
  • modal
  • cards

Size & style: width - 48px, height - 48px;
Font family: Roboto Regular,
Font size: 16px, 8px gap between spinner and text

3. Big spinner (84px84px)
84 x 84px (5.25rem x 5.25rem)

Please wait

Designed for:

  • full-screen loading
  • main content area
  • big tables

Size & style: width - 84px, height - 84px;
Font family: Roboto Regular,
Font size: 16px, 8px gap between spinner and text

States

Loader has 3 states determined by time to inform user about actual state of the system. Spinner animation is not changing but what is changing is the additional text.

1. State in case of quick loading

When loading takes less then 10 seconds, text says: Please wait

Please wait

2. State when loading takes more time

When loading takes more than 10 seconds and less than 60 seconds, text says: It takes longer than expected, please wait

Information that it takes longer than expected is placed on first line and on second line is the call to wait.

It takes longer than expected,
please wait

3. State in case that some error occurred or it is taking a long time

When loading takes more than 60 seconds, text says: Error occurred during loading, please refresh.

"Refresh" is used as a text button and after click it refreshes webpage.

Information that error occurred during loading is placed on first line and on second line is the call to refresh page.

Error occurred during loading,
please refresh.

Animation

Duration of one loop is 0,7 second. Here is table how tiles loosing and restoring opacity:

Time 0s 0,110s 0,147s 0,257s 0,294s 0,404s 0,441s 0,551s 0,558s 0,7s
1. Arrow 100% 85% 80% 65% 60% 45% 40% 25% 20% 5%
2. Arrow 80% 65% 60% 45% 40% 25% 20% 5% 100% 85%
3. Arrow 60% 45% 40% 25% 20% 5% 100% 85% 80% 65%
4. Arrow 40% 25% 20% 5% 100% 85% 80% 65% 60% 45%
5. Arrow 20% 5% 100% 85% 80% 65% 60% 45% 40% 25%

Each tile loses its opacity until it reaches 5% and then it is restored to 100%.

Globalization

Both RTL and LTR versions of spinner animation are same (clockwise). One exception is the text information, the flow how the text is read:

  • For RTL markets the additional text follows principles of RTL writing and it is centered aligned.
  • LTR version has the text flow from left to right.
